Figure 26. A comparison of the quasi-regular snake-like orbits for the N (red) and R (blue) systems,
run for 200 time steps. These orbits have the symbol sequence AmB3 for m odd, and in both systems,
each trajectory has two sharp turning points separated by some number n of bumps. The value of
n increases with decreasing initial angular momentum in the (ρ, λ) plane. For the N system, FM
initial conditions were used, with the square (barely visible near the top of each ﬁgure) indicating the
starting point. In the R system, FE initial conditions were used with η = 0.75. The R orbits have a
narrow hourglass shape, whereas the N orbits in the upper row lie in a cylinder notably larger in size
in the ρ direction.

Figure 27. A comparison of orbits with the symbol sequence AB3 for 200 time steps with FM initial
conditions. The N system (red) is shown at the upper left and the R system (blue) in the remaining
three plots for different values of η. As η increases, the R trajectories develop a kink along the λ = 0
axis, displaying a double-banding pattern with two turning points at two distinct distances from the
ρ axis about λ = 0.
